website_summaries.verdict: Those more interested in getting excellent audio quality for their money than high-end design or a big brand name will appreciate the Status Audio CB-1 over-the-ear headphones.
pros: The Status Audio CB-1 headphones sound much better than their low price might suggest
Extra padding on the ear cups and headband give you all-day comfort
Removable coiled and straight cords included
cons: Though comfortable, the ergonomic ear pads don't offer the best sound isolation
The generic design is, well, generic
Their big size and lack of a cord with an in-line mic make them less attractive for mobile use

customer_reviews.title: If these have the sound signature you like, you'll love them.
customer_reviews.text: This won't surprise you if you've read all the other reviews, but these headphones are amazing for the price. They have punchy bass that's slightly more aggressive than my DT-770 80ohms, but it's never muddy. The highs aren't as refined as most $200-300 cans, but they're at least as good as anything under $200 that I've tried. They're comfortable, I can swap the cables easily, and they're inconspicuous. I bought them as a cheap pair to throw in my bag and use in the office, and now I'm listening to them at least as much as my DT-770s.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah S

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones because I needed a new set, these had great reviews for the 1st gen version, which is this product. But after reading other reviews, they're now sending out a gen 2 version which is made cheaper than the 1st gen. The headband does not keep its adjustment, its very loose and creaks. The speakers are ok, nothing extremely fancy about them. P.S. There is another review on here that shows how the new and old versions look like side by side.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for Beats like sound; look somewhere else.
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal audiophile like grade sound. If you like your music clean and free of any artificial digital processing, these reference level headphones are the ticket. I like all genres of music and my entire music collection sounds great. In particular, I'm rediscovering my classical collection. These timeless works have never sounded better. I mostly use these cans with either my SupremeFX Hi-Fi DAC or my newly purchased Sony NW-ZX300 DAP. But, the magic is really released when combined with my Cowon P1 DAP and listening to Tchaikovsky's Symphony #5. It is like hearing it again for the very first time. I have been able to notice things in the recording that I have never noticed before.
customer_reviews.author: Charles J. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Plastic adjustment cracks and breaks
customer_reviews.text: They came on time are fantastic sounding studio headphones however the plastic adjustment area cracked and broke 😞😞I loved theses until this happened I have a 5 year old pair of Skullcandy Hesh headphones and used them extensively until I got my status cb phones. I have returned these to a amazon they were never dropped or treated roughly now I am a Searching for a replacement ether Skullcandy’s wired Hesh 2.0 or Audio-technicas m-40-X. Very disappointed ☹️ they were super comfortable and sounded awesome. Meanwhile using my Hesh ones again.
customer_reviews.author: Lenora A. Alberson

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound, comfortable, and good build quality.
customer_reviews.text: For what I paid for these headphones, I can't complain. They sound decent and are reasonably comfortable during long listening sessions. I originally bought a pair of Audio-Technica m40x headphones and loved the sound, but they were terribly uncomfortable. It was unfortunate, as they were great sounding headphones, though more expensive than the CB-1's. The CB-1's do the job just fine, and sound pretty good. The bass is a bit larger than with the AT m40x, but the mids/highs aren't quite as good. But overall, I'm quite pleased with the sound and build quality of a pair of headphones I paid only $55 for. At this price, they are difficult to beat.
customer_reviews.author: S. LEECH

customer_reviews.title: The only studio headphones you need at a killer direct price!
customer_reviews.text: As a full time musician in my second job we often rehearse using a jam hub without amps and wearing some top name middle/upper level headphones that haven't lasted the test of time in actual studio usage. I picked up a pair of CB1s and the comfort alone was amazing and the noise cancelling meant I wouldn't hear the drummer hitting his rubber cymbals except through my mic. The quality and foldability of these makes them easy to move around. The comfort and killer sound quality impressed my bandmates enough that we dumping the other brands starting with S's and now going to the intentionally no name Status to outfit our entire rehearsal studio, they are that good!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Current product is not the same product getting great reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Reading all the reviews, seeing the pictures, and watching YouTube videos. I got so excited to get these today only to be extremely disappointed. Ear pads are terrible and sound quality is trash. They are a different version then what’s getting the great reviews. Pretty sad. DO NOT BUY! They are not actually what you think you will be getting if you have done your research. I returned them immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Sound from Left Channel Using Provided Cables (both of them)...
customer_reviews.text: I can get sound using a separately purchased cable. But I really wanted to take advantage of both the long and coiled cables provided with these phones. They DO NOT WORK. Very disappointed. Sound not so great either: although flat, which I like, there is distortion with loud mids and treble, and almost hidden bass. Confused by the idolatry from Zeos and other reviewers on youtube. Moreover, had to use dac/amp with iphone to get decent volume - a surprise. But they're cheap...
customer_reviews.author: N. Sims

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money. Tinny sounds.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for half a year now, and realized all my mixes have such dull bass. I decided to spend my money on the Neumann NDH 20, which costs me 5 bills. Comparing side by side, this headphone (large 50mm drivers) put out more tinny sounds comparing to the Neumann (smaller 39mm drivers). Which now makes sense why my mixes have too much bass, as I unknowingly compensated for the tinny sounds. I'll keep this headphone for playing the keyboard, but when the sound quality is critical, I'll use the Neumann instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality for the price and surprising comfort for non-cloth ear-pads
customer_reviews.text: As someone who loves cloth-covered ear-pads, I was very delighted to put these on for a few hours and not have gross sweat around my ears. Despite their bulky look, they are very comfortable and I barely notice they're on my head. The sound is some of the best I've heard from closed-back headphones, and especially for the price these are hard to beat. The 2 included cables and 1/4 inch adapter are nice touches as well. I can't speak for the rest of their lineup, but Status has done very well with the CB-1s.
customer_reviews.author: A. Arbit

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones; a giant killer for sure
customer_reviews.text: Such a great headphone! I am an audiophile with headphones ranging from Sony 7506 and Audio technica M50X to Oppo PM1, PM3 and Sennheiser HD600 and HD800S. This is a great closed back headphone. It is definitely better than audio technicas, better than all of them. It is not as clear as Oppo's and Senneheiser 800 and 600, which is not a big surprise. Its price is a fraction of them. Overall, a solid headphone with a warm sound signature.
customer_reviews.author: Emadi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound remarkably sweet and clear with good bass and treble response, no frills, and really very good comfort. They sound as good, for the most part, than many more expensive cans. They are an absolute steal for the price. I own several other headphones including Beyer, Grado, Sennheiser, and Audio Technica. In comparison, these offer impressive and very respectable sound quality for a very low price. A Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: The five star reviews are true!
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely 5 star headphones. I cannot believe they are only 80 dollars. I had purchased a pair of 300 dollar headphones and returned them for the sound quality. I took a chance ordering these but boy I am happy I did. The sound is great from Megadeath to classical. Great highs and mids but plenty of bass but not too much. If you like a ton of bass these may not be for you. Light and comfortable to wear, if you are looking for a high quality headphone at a bargain price these are it!
customer_reviews.author: Martman

customer_reviews.title: Insanely good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these on the recommendation of a coworker who owned a pair for several years. I was blown away by the sound quality and how well they cancel the office chatter. It is almost impossible to hear anything with these on my head. I purchased a case and line cord with inline microphone to go with them, and I can use them for conference calls as well via Skype. I am overjoyed by this purchase for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Stealth Quality
customer_reviews.text: Have tried quite a few headphones ranging from 20-300 dollars and I couldn't ignore this deal. It turns out that this is the best bang for your buck at this price range. I love the packaging and minimalist styling of everything. Get the Status Audio cable 2-pack as well, they are incredible quality for the price compared to similar products you might want to pick up. The sound is crystal clear and has not been tweaked in any way-also are not too harsh in the treble (highs) range and the bass is warm and rich without being going over the top or wearing out the ears too quickly. Overall, I'd definitely recommend and might be buying a second set :)
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Worth the hype
customer_reviews.text: Never really owned headphones that weren't earbuds before Saw these several places and they came highly recommended, so when I caught them on sale I figured I'd give them a shot Fell in love at first listen Sturdy but not too heavy-duty, a little on the "quiet" side but considering how much noise they block from the outside world I don't need my music up as loud so I'm thinking that'll work out in my favor in the long run Looking into a microphone attachment to turn them into a gaming headset soon
customer_reviews.author: D J

customer_reviews.title: I paired these with a Fiio A3 and the bass was excellent on my fire tablet the vocals where also clean ...
customer_reviews.text: they punch way above their weight class,I paired these with a Fiio A3 and the bass was excellent on my fire tablet the vocals were also clean on the songs. I like these better than my audio technica m50x's, I also own some nvx xpt100 and these head phones have far better bass with an amp connected,the earpads are so soft that I didn't even buy replacement ear pads like I usually do for other headphones. my only complaint is the plastic build of the head band if it was metal like audio technica it would be a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: jurunjulo

customer_reviews.title: Good - but proprietary cable locking system = meh
customer_reviews.text: At $60, these are a great deal. I've had'em for three years. But also had a recent scare with signal loss in one ear. Turns out the cable leading into the phones had come untwisted. Me? I prefer my interconnects the good old-fashioned one size fits all method. If you want a cord locked into the cans, these are good, but some cords won't fit in deep enough, and the proprietary cord they send might get wonky. Other than this little problem, I think these are the best headphone value at this price point. ...And to be fair, other manufacturers suffer from the same problem, so...
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dreifort

customer_reviews.title: Sony, Sennheiser, and Audio-Technica, watch out.
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance with this startup audio company, and was not disappointed. Upgraded to these from ATH-M30x headphones, and these are superior in almost every way. Build quality is very good, with a sleek, sophisticated look that goes well with almost any setting. Audio quality is superb, with highs, mids, and lows all crisp and clear, as well as a magnificent soundstage. They're also very comfortable, especially the massive earcups. I can wear them continuously for several hours no problem. You'd typically have to pony up $200+ to get cans of this caliber. Highly recommend to any and all audiophiles.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the hard of hearing
customer_reviews.text: I am hard of hearing and have been searching for an ear phone or ear bud to listen on my computer and other devices. I have a drawer full of ear buds and head phones. Until I bought this one. The sound is incredible. There are no crazy sounding bass that distort and mask out all the other frequencies. The highs are crispy and clean and not irritating. Human voices are easily distinguishable. I can turn the volume up without distortion. I read the reviews of this product before purchasing and I have to agree with the review, it is one of the better headphones for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Hansen Tsang

customer_reviews.title: Best I have heard without huge price!
customer_reviews.text: Comfort - great cushioning Sound and Bass - 50mm driver really does the music justice When these are on, you will not be interrupted by other sounds. The aux cords are great, one for DJ'ing, and the other for travel. The aux plug screws onto the larger 3.5 mm plug. I would definitely recommend these to anyone. I even took these to work to let me co-workers listen and they were amazed at the sound and quality. Clarity is good for movies, music, radio, etc.
customer_reviews.author: knowhatimtalnbout

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Durability and Did not last
customer_reviews.text: Well sound is very good for the price. My problem is with quality and durability of the headphones. After about 13 months they headband broke. Not from dropping which I could understand but from opening to use. They have a one year warranty which I was out of the date but was told regardless of when a headband breaks it is not covered under warranty but they offer a discount for another purchase. I wish they had durability because the sound and comfort is good when not broken.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality - broke after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought these back in August and everything has been working fine until just recently the head band snapped from taking them on and off. The sounds is now distorted as well as if trying to put them back together has messed with the wiring as well. Unfortunately, it's been 5 months so I can't actually get my money back either :(
customer_reviews.author: b -

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound for the price, but don't get too attached
customer_reviews.text: Update: Purchased July 13th 2020, Died: September 23, 2020 they didn't last very long only a couple of months so changed the rating to 1 star as they will only sound good for a few months then just stop working, and one of the ear cups was getting loose as well. Wow, do these sound good, and for less than 100.00? Just crazy! Now don't except exception build quality. These are almost 98% plastic, after all. The sound far makes up for it but treat them gently. Compared to the Steel Seris Pro, Bose 700, and a Shure headset, these are still just a bit cheaply built.
customer_reviews.author: FearlessLeaderB

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: One of the arms cracked after less than 5 months of light-to-moderate use. I contacted the company and they said that they assume breakage is caused by rough use and they would only give me a credit of 50% towards a new set. My recommendation is to avoid this product and the company that produces it. There are many other headphones and good companies out there that provide better products and real warranties.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great sound quality for the price. Two (detachable) cables, both ~3 meters (~10 feet) but one coiled. Cons: Extremely cheap build quality. It feels like a sin to use a non-proprietary cable with the housing. I initially rated this pretty poorly for the incredibly poor build quality, but I keep thinking back to the sound quality. If you treat these as if they were origami they'll probably last you ages. Not giving it 5 stars because it really is fragile, but someone will find this trade-off great.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Stallings

customer_reviews.title: Great for Working at Home and Glasses Wearers
customer_reviews.text: I got these for overall work headphones when they were on sale for around $50. The bass is a little tinny as other reviews have noted, but I love them. They are SUPER comfortable. As a glasses wearer, comfort comes above all else for me. I can wear these for hours and not develop any headache symptoms or discomfort. They come with cord options and a nice box. The foldable aspect is also super nice for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I run a demo studio for broke musicians (rare I know). I don't charge a lot sometimes equipment trades. Most of the people have never been in a studio & most bitch about the head phones uncomfortable is the biggest complaint. I just did a 3 hr session for a band this week end & everyone agreed these are the best bang for buck. I recorded this band a couple of months ago & used audio tec & sinheiser phones. No comparison Status beats um hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Chiropractic Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by WIRED magazine and have performed as promised.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my teenager, who says the headphones are VERY comfortable to wear - even for hours long gaming sessions - and the sound reproduction is great - both for gaming and for listening to music while working. An added bonus is that they also work well as sound canceling earphones, which is nice if he's dong homework and someone is watching TV in the same room. I got them on sale before Christmas, but would be happy to buy another pair at the full price - well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: R. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Sound is really nice and noise is blocked out with the pads
customer_reviews.text: Researched the product on the net for headsets less than $100. Status Audio was near of at the top. Well, they were right. Extremely surprised at the softness of the over the ear cushion, Not a problem in the slightest wearing them for hours on end. Sound is really nice and noise is blocked out with the pads. Was it well worth it...definitely!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap only in price. Never had a new pair of headphones sound so good right out of the box. Efficient? Easiest headphones to drive yet. They just sound great. Couldn't be more happy with this purchase. Will be buying another pair for use outside the house. And don't let people tell you the build quality is bad. These are built like a tank but much lighter. The closed back will serve me well on trips as not to bother others while listening to music. Just very happy with this purchase. Okay, one minor bad comment...don't really like the way you have to adjust the headband.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Definitely get these
customer_reviews.text: Surprising sound accurate for the price I got it for. The mids are very goods on it. The lows too. They actually performed better than my Audio Technica M40s on everything I used on it. The design could have been a little more sturdier but it's still good. Can't believe sound vs price you are getting from these. It shocked me. For sound like this, you could pay at least over 100. These are a bargain and sound like a bargain to me. And it sounds great when used as gaming head phones for PS4. Definitely get these and a mic. Also throw a Boomstick with it too. Truse me, you will thank me on it
customer_reviews.author: Dickens Dumont

customer_reviews.title: Comfort beyond expectations
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones for my son. He's a big gamer and designer, so he's sort of picky about quality in a headset. After using the Status headphones for a few minutes, he insisted I try them on. The comfort was really unbelievable. You do not know how uncomfortable your current headset is. You just have no idea. When you put on the Status headset it's just heaven. Super plush and quiet. And the sound is top rate, according to my son. I'm not as into that part of the equation. I would say just based on the comfort they are a giant leap ahead of literally any headset I've ever tried. Just different, just better!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Lange

customer_reviews.title: Headphone doesn't stay in place
customer_reviews.text: After about a year of using this headphone, it started to move around not staying in place (on your head). There is a very weak point of this headphone, the swivel...if one picks it up by ear muff, there is a good chance the swivel part of the ear muff will break so the ear muff just kinda hanging on. I had to tape it up to to prevent the ear muff from breaking off completely. This headphone's design somewhat lacking the quality to wear it on for more than 2 hrs...too warm. Its sound quality is pretty decent as well as the noise cancellation feature.
customer_reviews.author: isleepwalk

customer_reviews.title: Very good headphone, best in the price range
customer_reviews.text: Bought it after I saw excited reviews on Verge and other sites. There was a deal going on and thought it is good to have a secondary headphone. I love it. Way better than those Beats by Dr. Dre. Almost studio quality. Interestingly the sound quality and experience is comparable to the Sennheiser Urbanite I use (comparable, not as good as Urbanite of-course, which I paid four times as much for). It compares as good as most 150~ headphones.
customer_reviews.author: nafSadh

customer_reviews.title: Great FLAT Sound and decent build quality
customer_reviews.text: The sound on these igreat however, do not expect much bass. The clarity is great on these and the volume is great. i like the small touches like the twist on the cable to allow it to lock into the headset and the coiled aux cable. The build is mostly plastic which gives them a slightly cheap feel and a fragile build for someone with a larger head. The sound leaks at high volumes and there is not much sound cancellation but I'd recommend at this price range
customer_reviews.author: Izzy G

customer_reviews.title: You WILL NOT BE disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones offer exceptional performance and real value.The bass is not artificially exaggerated, but if bass is in the recording, you will hear it clearly with the 50 mm drivers. These are monitors, therefore they do not 'add' artificial sound levels to what you hear. You hear the music the way the Artist intended it to sound. The pads are super soft around the ears and the clamping force is light, even with the headphones completely compacted. Recording quality varies widely, so if they seem too quiet, look for a different source for your music. At 32 ohms these can be driven loudly with a cell phone or tablet. Awesome sound, all-day comfort, all at a great price!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim B

customer_reviews.title: Ok for gaming and video, would not use for music monitoring
customer_reviews.text: For music monitoring, Sony's iconic MDR 7506 is significantly better with a wider dynamic range and clearer sound (tested with a digital piano). The CB-1 is however a lot more comfortable and has a removable cable. I'm now using it as communication and gaming headset, paired with a V-MODA BoomPro mic. This combo offers a great sound _and_ mic quality in that price range The "all-plastic" build quality is ok but I would not expect it to last more than 2-3 years.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: They’re exactly what they’re meant to be.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these monitors last year as I’ve recently gotten into audio production and mixing. I have to say, they sound amazing for the price and they’re extremely durable. (I’ve gotten frustrated at Fruity Loops a few times using them, lol) Sound is flat so they’re perfect for professional mixing and great for aspiring audiophiles like myself. Don’t expect true noise cancellation as they aren’t ANC, however, isolation is definitely there. Obviously spending 3-4x more will get you a true audiophile experience, but they do what they’re made to do and they do it great.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Bellah

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable headphones but cables
customer_reviews.text: Good HiFi quality headphones, very comfortable, light, stylish, but with one glaring omission - out of two included detachable cables none include the microphone. I have a spare leftover cable from my Monoprice 8323 so I used that, but I cannot understand the logic. The same issue for me is with AudioTechnica M40x - cable without microphone, you have to buy third party cable. In this day and age of mobile phones, tablets, even laptops with 4 poiint TRRS jacks, having outdated 3 point TRS cable and no mic is mind boggling.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest_Lou

customer_reviews.title: They are almost worth the price ,I dont use them but extras
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were priced correctly, they aren't $100 like ATH 40x but they have a nice warm sound and they are very soft so comfort is my favorite thing here,I dont feel like I paid too much but any more and I might have ,Ive given them a few days to burn in and they do sound a little better each day so maybe these will turn out to be a really good deal or not but anyone getting these for a xmas present would be happy unless they have expensive tastes over $100 but for around $60 for comfort they are fine Thank You Happy Holidays rsdno
customer_reviews.author: rsdno

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality for the price. I haven't been producing for too long. So I can't personally compare these to any other studio headphones, but the people I've been getting feedback from say that my mixing is much better since I got them. Also in a time where branding and logos are a large majority of the price you pay for products, I love the direction Status Audio is taking not worrying about the logos put on the headphones. Simply the quality. Can't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Anderson

customer_reviews.title: These fit cranial endowed and sound great
customer_reviews.text: After looking for a pair of headphone that will fit the cranial endowed, I found these. If you have a large head, give these a serious look. They don't squeeze your head, have really good padding and sound great for the money. They sound better then any gaming headset used before to include ones that cost double these. Not the best judge of bass because that in not the regular music listened to. I do used these with my cell phone and they work really well. I would highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for a few months. A solid choice in the price bracket. Others describe the frequency response as "neutral" but in my personal opinion it isn't. I'd say it has a slight V shaped response; elevated mid-bass and lower treble. All in all, not gonna knock it for that, it's a good sounding phone for the price. Sound signature will provide plenty of fun with modern music. I heard the shp9500 as well and that thing was so much brighter sounding that it sounded tinny. Don't get why everyone seems to like it. Way too metallic sounding for my taste. This thing, while still kind of bright, is much more laid back in the treble by comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Headphones for big head
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was recommended for a big head (my hat size is 7 5/8). A month earlier I bought a one-size-fits-all and had to give it to my wife, because I couldn't wear it for a minute without pain. This one lasts a half-hour or so, but after that it still pinches and cuts off circulation a bit. I don't see why manufacturers can't make one with a hinge on top that we set its angle with a hand-knob screw. I'm a acoustic musician and the sound is good enough for my ears.
customer_reviews.author: David K.. Dirlam

customer_reviews.title: Poor Durability
customer_reviews.text: Almost the entire headset is made of plastic. On both sides the piece with the adjustment numbers that slides into and out of the top headpiece is cracked. One side has almost completely snapped off. I'm not rough with these in any way, and I don't have a giant head. For the price, the sound quality is great but it should really be made of metal. These were going to be my new favorite headphones
customer_reviews.author: Michael Grey

customer_reviews.title: no sound from right ear not even a year since purchasing-good while they lasted
customer_reviews.text: kinda super bummed when i went to mix/record some music and my only headphones only have sound coming out of left side suddenly- no crimps in wire, in fact i was very gentle with these and was shocked for this to have happened at all :{ just know if your looking to buy headphones that last years and years (i know they exist cuz ive had some) then you might want to look elwehere, if you can afford to buy these several times and dont mind being out of operation and not able to craft music, they might be for you :}
customer_reviews.author: Cyskie

customer_reviews.title: Nice For The Money
customer_reviews.text: At $70.00, they are moderately priced and sound decent for the money. I use them for mixing backing tracks. My only complaints are that the mid-range frequencies are a little predominant and they have a tendency to fall forward on my head. Probably not ideal for bassheads. But they are otherwise comfortable and worth their modest price. The construction is decent and I like that the cord is detachable. I do recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Alan David

customer_reviews.title: These are the headphones you want.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones for the price. These headphones let you hear your music as it was created by the artist. The reviews on these headphones and articles that I had read from various sources was the reason I bought the headphones. I should have bought them a year or two ago, but was not sure on buying them. I'm glad I finally bought them. I would highly recommend that if you are looking for a great set of headphones, buy these. I will be telling my friends and family about them. I'm sure that when I let them hear the music using these headphones, they will buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Pete X

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value
customer_reviews.text: These headphones live up to their hype. Sound is crisp and clear. Very neutral headphones. The build quality isn't the best, but the ear cups are very comfortable. At times It feels like I'm holding to a set of 20 dollar headphones. Also wish the headband could have more room for adjustment. I have a big head and barely fit me when they are maxed out. I use them in my cubicle/office environment and can wear them for hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: I was slightly wary of purchasing something like this without him trying them on first
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a gift for my husband who is very difficult to buy for. I was slightly wary of purchasing something like this without him trying them on first, but the reviews were so positive I decided to take a chance. SO glad I did!! These are absolutely stellar! Clear and well balanced sound. These are top quality. Five stars. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Fine but caused and issue with my set up
customer_reviews.text: They work fine, price is on point for an okay set of headphones. For some reason though when I plugged them in I could no longer hear sound through chrome. Works for everything else but I can no longer get sound through chrome, I tried everything, sound settings, restarting, driver updates, complete uninstall and re install. Nothing. No idea why but other than that the headphones themselves are fine.
customer_reviews.author: ChillC

customer_reviews.title: these sound excellent. Nothing lacking
customer_reviews.text: for the price, these sound excellent. Nothing lacking. I prefer a flat response sound with no extra bass, and these are flat. I am a Denon AH-D2000 headphone user (very flat sounding), and although they dont sound that good, they are very close. If you are a beginner to high quality sound these will sound great. My only complaint is that they are not big enough for my large head. The bottom edge of the cups do not quite sit flush on my head. If the band extended another half inch they would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: FIve Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are really, really good cans. I have had several pairs, but these are by far the best. They have not gotten uncomfortable on my ears and the sound is excellent. I mainly use them for listening to music, so it was hard for me to justify spending too much $$$ for headphones, but I ran across these, checked the reviews and decided to roll the dice. I am extremely satisfied that I did. As I said, they are very comfortable and the sound is great. Can't speak for the quality from a professional sound mixer's perspective, but I have found the last set of cans I will ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: I am speechless.
customer_reviews.text: You cannot pass up this amazing quality at such affordable price. I am blown away by the sound of these headphones. The comfort is better than excellent. And the sound stage is overwhelming. Don’t hesitate to buy these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had defect/build issues, quickly serviced.
customer_reviews.text: Immediately after getting these I could tell the plastic was so cheap and thin that they need to be handled like they're made of glass. This was generally to be expected, but unfortunately even with delicate care after just under a year there is now issues with the audio in the right driver. I would definitely consider other headphones if you want them to last. EDIT: Though I did have the issue I mentioned customer service was very prompt in assisting me in getting a warranty replacement. Will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Right side just stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones worked great until they didn't. They don't get heavy use, they don't travel. They sit on my desk for occasional time when I need headphones. Put them on today, and the left speaker doesn't work. Checked cables, checked outputs, all fine. The speaker just stopped working. If I through these things around, or they traveled at all, I wouldn't be so surprised, but these headphones get maybe 5 hours of use in any given week. I figured for the price they would last a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Truck Johnson

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit and amazing sound
customer_reviews.text: Colour me amazed! I've not always been a huge headphone fan. Most tend to get sore around glasses so I've always stuck to high class home audio. These have changed that outlook. Exceptionally comfortable even for long listening sessions, with power and clarity deserving of 5 or 6 times the price. After using them, I would not bat an eyelid if the asking price was considerably higher. They were so good I went back and bought some HD One for on ear more discreet listening, which are also excellent by the way! I'll be keeping an eye on this company and probably buying most things they make. I'm officially a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Ra ke sh A

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. The headphones are beautiful
customer_reviews.text: First off, I was very impressed with the quality of the packaging. Very nice. The headphones are beautiful. Clean and classically styled Studeo Monitors. I've used AKG 240's for decades. The build quality of these headphones was quickly evident. Again, very nice! Love the fact that the cords (2!) are robust '&' detachable. Making life much simpler should the need to replace one of them ever arise. The fit? Very comfortable. The sound? Superb! Bravo!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you would think they are and more
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what you would think they are and more. Very neutral and clean sounding. Earpiece very plush and comfortable, does not smash your head. Love the 2 cords it came with. I mostly use it for ipod or practicing guitar/bass with the aux out on my amp & they sound clear playing along with tracks. They are a bit unwieldy & not very portable but they're not meant for that. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sedith

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are amazing exceptional!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend anybody get these headphones if they want a true flat sound! Everything from the headband to the soft cushiony earpads are amazing. I use these headphones for everything, whether thats making music or listening to it. Watching movies for long periods of time with these on is amazing I honestly forget that they're on sometimes. These headphones have such a great sound for the money and are honestly great Audio Technica M50x competitors! You would not be making a mistake purchasing these!
customer_reviews.author: Joakeem

customer_reviews.title: VERY Overrated
customer_reviews.text: I'm a collector/hoarder/enthusiast of both Headphones and IEMs. I am fair with not expecting budget priced items to compete with $500 headphones. With that said, there are just far better deals in the game than this. Get a pair of HD6XX, 1 More Triple Driver over ears, AKG7XX off top of my head. You'll thank me if you ever compare..the difference is insane.
customer_reviews.author: JPK17

customer_reviews.title: Great while they lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these headphones for a year and a half. I use them at work. The Right side has now stopped working. Sound quality is great. If you want more bass then be sure you have an equalizer. The sound card has this and I can turn up the bass or down depending on what I’m listing too. They’re very comfortable and I can wear them all day.
customer_reviews.author: Jaimer_

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding headphones
customer_reviews.text: The sound will not be for everyone, it's really flat with nice base. The material feels cheap but it's reasonable for the price, the pads are really big and I personally feel like they're not as comfortable as some Bluetooth headphones I've tried (even some budget options). But the sound is great, super clear, I don't mix so I'm not sure if this sound is what someone would look for. You have to equalize them but they can work for different types of music. Overall great buy, all the negatives was me just being nit-picky.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Wow great comfort and sound for a honestly a great price is a wonderful sight to be hold now days.
customer_reviews.text: Just got these in from a place called status audio and man the sound is so clean and are really comfortable they go over my ears great and the y feel sturdily built and stay on the head lightly yet really firmly i give this company praise on what there doing with sound and you receive 2 high quality cables with it for 80$ man best purchase ive ever made and hope these are with me for years to come thanks status audio
customer_reviews.author: kraig

customer_reviews.title: these are amazing headphones. Second
customer_reviews.text: First off, these are amazing headphones. Second, they are even more amazing headphones for the price. I was on the hunt for a good pair of studio-quality headphones for production, mixing, and recording purposes, and these blew 2 other brands I tried out of the water. Customer service was responsive as well. It does bleed a bit more than other headphones when using them as monitors for a vocalist, but it's still a negligible amount when you are making a professional quality record. If that is something you are very peculiar about, take it into consideration. But overall, I'd give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Nima

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably great headphones! To get quality like this from other ...
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably great headphones! To get quality like this from other brands you'd have to pay almost double the cost. So far I've used them for listening to vinyls, gaming (had to buy a mic separate), and just music in general and it worked great for all that. Not to mention they're extremely comfortable so much so that I forget I have them on sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Scroopy Noopers

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built. They sound very nice, but lacking,(only slightly), in the bass I am accustomed to in broadcasting. A good back up to my Audio Technica headphones. Sometimes you just have to try something new to see if it is better than what you have. Sticking with my AT50's for broadcast. I might just use the Status Audio headphones, for my personal music listening pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: SteveO

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, elegant and a coiled cord.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty satisfied with these headphones so far, no problems at all. I'm not an audiophile but I feel these provide a very reasonable sound quality for the price and more so they're incredibly comfortable. Most headphones I wear my hears will ache or they get sweaty but these ones go over my ear very softly so if you're going to wear these all day you'll be satisfied. The coiled cord is also a huge bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sound, Pretty Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I was getting really close with these. Sound was fine, detachable cable is nice, etc... But what about comfort??? These were better than most, but still not what I needed. So the sound quality is good, the comfort isn't bad... but for $20 more you could get the Takstar Pro 82, or (for a lot more) you could get the Sony MDR-1A, both of which are very comfortable and can be worn for a long time imo.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M

customer_reviews.title: A great set of headphones for sub-$100
customer_reviews.text: A great set of headphones for sub-$100. Comfort: 9/10 Aesthetics: 7/10 Sound: 9/10 Build Quality: 8/10 The only 2 things I can find that I dislike about this headphone are that the hinges are plastic and feel a bit vulnerable, and one of the earcups was inserted backwards, which really pisses me off. Other than that, I cannot complain. A little bit weird to wear in public though. Great product Status!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't expect them to sound so good
customer_reviews.text: This is a passive noise cancellation headphone. The padding is plush, comfortable and easy to wipe clean. The sound quality is EXCELLENT. I didn't expect them to be so clean and flat. I'll definitely get my next headphones from Status.
customer_reviews.author: Cedric P. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is great but....
customer_reviews.text: Why are there smudges and lines on my headphone? I just received it today and I see some smudges and a bit of lines on my left ear side.... The sound adjusts by itself which is really weird. I didn't even touch the volume panel but it automatically adjusts its volume.... I also hear a buzzling sound in my headphone... Is it possible to send a new headphone or give 20 or 30 bucks back so I can buy the headphone again?
customer_reviews.author: Peter Kwon

customer_reviews.title: A potential revolution in the low end headphone market
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are every bit as good as the reviews suggested. They sound excellent and are the most comfortable circumaural headphones I have owned. They isolate impressively without the uncomfortable clamping force of the ATK M50x, even the build quality appears better than expected for the price. I have now owned them for over 2 months and I'm still blown away every time I put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: What a great product! The sound is incredible. I have a pair of HK BT headphones that cost 4x more and these are better. The comfort is also the best I've experienced. I've worn them for hours and you almost forget they are physically are there. Build quality seems very good but I haven't owned them long enough to assess any long-term issues. At this price point I was shocked to get both curled and straight replaceable cables. The connection at the headphone is a twist to lock mechanism -- haven't seen that in a consumer product before. Highly recommend to anyone looking for great quality and premium sound at a rational price.
customer_reviews.author: BioGeek

customer_reviews.title: Nice Headphones With A Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these headphones and have been using it a little more than exactly a year now. One flaw with these headphones that you will start to notice is that the adjustable sliders on the headband are made of plastic and kind of flimsy. The sliders on my headphones have already slightly cracked on both sides just from regular wear (stretch/opening up the headphones a bit in order to wear it). If not for the sliders, these headphones would be that much better. PROS: - Good sound quality - Price - Lightweight and comfortable to wear for long periods CONS: - Plastic adjustable sliders are flimsy and will likely start cracking/breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Jay B.

customer_reviews.title: Really like the headphones
customer_reviews.text: Really like the headphones. I would definitely buy again. Pros: The sound quality is great, but not being noise cancelling they are very good for the office where someone may need to get your attention. They are very light and the fit is great, very comfortable. I wear glasses and they don't cause the glasses to dig into the side. Cons: the cord isn't so great, the weight means it's not wonderful when carrying the phone around. They also aren't the easiest for travel, they don't have a case or fit well in a bag. Overall: really happy with the purchase, great for home or office use.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great for $40 on sale. But cheaply made...
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound quality for $40 on sale! Comfortable too. But the build quality is terrible. These will not last long. At best, it's decent buy at $40, but $70 is crazy. For that same price you could get the Philips 9500, which is a home run for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: but I do find them comfortable for long periods (hours at a time)
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional by any means, just a casual listener who wants good-sounding music and some isolation from background noise while working at my computer. I've never owned headphones of this type before so I can't compare them to other brands, but I do find them comfortable for long periods (hours at a time), the sound is great, and they cut out some (but not all) background noise. The removable cord is a nice addition, and the end that plugs in to the source has a nice metal spring to prevent it from bending too much and eventually splitting like so many laptop cords do. So far, very pleased with these.
customer_reviews.author: MikeF

customer_reviews.title: Very Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these audio CB-1 Headphones for about $50 (on a lightning deal). These headphones are great for the price, the noise cancellation is lacking compared to actual noise cancellation headphones (obviously), but the comfort level is very VERY good. I personally am not an audiophile, and neither are my friends that I have asked to try them. They do however have a much better ear for audio than I do, and they say that these are a good pair of headphones (they are harsh). Conclusion I have enjoyed my pair, and I am happy with my purchase. I will let you determine whether this is the item for you.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: 60 days later dead in one ear
customer_reviews.text: Not bad... until they stop working. 60 days of use and they're dead in one ear. I wouldn't mind if I only had one ear, but, not so good for people with two ears. I highly recommend it if you have one ear, although in another 60 days I might change that to if you have no ears.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but a bit cheaply made and not great for studio mixing as touted.
customer_reviews.text: cant believe they’re saying these are perfect for studio mixing, and have a flat frequency response. No comparison to the AT 50s, which I do use to mix. The set I ordered in May are dead already. Upon inspection, the cheap connection to the sound diaphram is gone. Positives are they were comfortable, and I was able to salvage the ear cushions. When they worked, they were quiet and could be used to track, but no way is that a flat frequency response.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Huston Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Consider Other Options if you have a Gigantic Head
customer_reviews.text: These sound pretty good, not sure if I like them more or less than the Audio Technica ATH-M50x. But potential buyers should be aware: if you've got a big head, these might not fit you. They don't adjust far enough to sit on my ears properly, and the ear pads are legitimately enormous which exacerbates the issue. The price is good though and they sound fine so I'll hang onto them for work--maybe they'll fit a little better after they break in!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compared to Sony MDR-V6
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Sony MDR-V6 headphones, which are amazing but lack the detachable cord. I was hoping these would be in a similar category, but they are well behind the Sony's audio quality. These are probably fine for most people (as witnessed by all the five start reviews) but if you have every owned a really good set of headphones you will be disappointed. Also, I didn't find these to be very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Pralite Monk

customer_reviews.title: Worth so much more than what I paid
customer_reviews.text: I buy these after seeing a lot of good reviews about sound quality vs price, I had the opportunity to buy them at Black Friday (47 USD), the noise cancelling is decent, the comfort is great... The sound quality is excellent, I have never listen to my music with so much detail and clarity, bass is more than satisfying, all my other earphones and headphones sound cheap and inadequate in comparison, so much that I almost regret to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Andres Cortes

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews when I like things usually. BUT, these have better sound than anything I've used. Take it from me, a stranger on the internet who has purchased lots of audio equipment. These will change your life and leave you forever dissapointed with the sound quality of other headphones. Audiophile's enjoy, you have been blessed with a less expensive option for perfect sound!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Preston

customer_reviews.title: There are two different products essentially
customer_reviews.text: The first one I bought came with big earcup and had better build quality. Plus it also had different wires. Then the one bought now the build quality if is a bit less in all honesty and different earcups and wires. Both products are good I just think they should sell both separately so that people know what they are specifically buying. the build quality on the new one might have been effected by the current pandemic so that could be a reason why. Both are good just depends on preference.
customer_reviews.author: Chigaemecha

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2nd pair!
customer_reviews.text: I owned my first pair for about a year and then my wife, who works recording voiceovers, took them. She loves them more than the Sony MDR7506 she was using. I use several headphones including the HD280 Pro (hate these) and the ATH M40x (great) yet I still default to using the SA CB-1. These are comfortable and for the most part, flat enough to mix audio with.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: These are very good headphones. detailed highs
customer_reviews.text: These are very good headphones. detailed highs, punchy lows, and natural mids. also it is very easy to drive. i think these are as good as the AT M50's at half the price. Build quality is ok, but if you handle with care shouldn't have problems breaking on you.
customer_reviews.author: Young S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome studio reference cans
customer_reviews.text: Not your kids headphones... if you are looking for bass busters they look elsewhere. If you are look for a good reference closed back set of cans at a price you don't have to take a second out on.... these are for you. Nice clean range from lows to highs no muddling. I like them a lot and recommend them for any mixing or just for just listening to clean music. If all you have is MP3's move on these are not for you as they would be a waste of money....
customer_reviews.author: Poppa

customer_reviews.title: Very nice headphones
customer_reviews.text: I'm blown away by the sound quality of these headphones, I use them for gaming, listening to music and movies, they sound fantastic.the only thing I wish they had was a mic for the games and they would be perfect, other than that amazing deal, the interchange cables are very nice quality, dont pass up these headphones if your in the market for some good headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: They are okay but not worth 60+
customer_reviews.text: They're comfortable, I can wear them for hours without any discomfort. The build quality is okay but is made entirely of plastic. Lastly, the sound isn't anything great, maybe I expected too much after reading and watching a lot of very positive reviews. They were pretty old reviews so maybe something changed. I wouldn't recommend paying more than $40-45 for them.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Very well built, especially considering the price
customer_reviews.text: I got these so I could play guitar late at night and not keep the family up, and they work great. Sound quality is great, they are very comfortable (even during long sessions) and they keep the noise where it is supposed to be. I really like the removable cable, as that is always the failure point of my headphones. Only thing to keep in mind is that a headphone amp might be needed for some devices.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: All I wanted was some studio headphones that are comfortable and have good sound quality. And that's what I got! These are quality headphones without extra frills. If you're a single player gamer like me these are great for long gaming sessions, unlike most gaming headsets which compromise sound quality and comfort for a mic and other gaming features.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Hansen

customer_reviews.title: The cheapest feeling headphones
customer_reviews.text: The build quality on the CB-1 is terrible. The arms don't stay where you adjust them and just slide to max length, the pads are thin, and the sound is bad, even compared to some TASCAM TH-02 I have. Got them on a lightning deal and they're still not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hampton

customer_reviews.title: ... just got these a few days ago and are amazing for the price you pay
customer_reviews.text: I just got these a few days ago and are amazing for the price you pay. For a producer of music, and one watches many YouTube videos, I couldn't have asked for a better product!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Truly As Good As Headphones That Cost Twice As Much
customer_reviews.text: I regularly used a pair of ATH-M50x headphones for 2 years. The left side blew out due to user error - plugging it into a very high output amp - so I needed a new pair. When these arrived I put them on instantly and got right back to all the things I had been doing with the M50s, which are well-known as being very balanced. I noticed virtually no difference from the M50s, except that these Status Audio headphones didn't seem to be playing inside my skull, which was something I always disliked about the M50s. This was a very good thing considering these are half the price and sound at least as good as the M50s.
customer_reviews.author: S Anchour

customer_reviews.title: Great at their price point
customer_reviews.text: Good headphones for the price. However I compared them to the HD598Cs. The CB-1s seemed dull and the sound stage was not anywhere near as good as the Sennheiser. They also have smaller ear cups so keep that in mind. The key point is the price point, at $50 odd the CB-1 is great value!
customer_reviews.author: NavH

customer_reviews.title: Partially DOA
customer_reviews.text: Only the right driver worked and even it was only working intermittently. Tried 3 different cables to no avail. Sent back and will not buy again. I was also not impressed with the build quality which used a very cheap plastic. Not worth even half of the retail price.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Galeano

customer_reviews.title: Big Head Comfort, Good Sound
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews for headphones for larger heads (men's hat size large to x-large), I decided to get these for comfort. Positives: Good headband adjustment. Just large enough cups. Good sound quality. Doesn't squish my ears and glasses against my skull. Negatives: Straight cord had a short, bad enough to make one side not work. Fortunately, curled cord was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Status Audio CB-1 Closed Back Studio Monitor Headphones with 50mm Drivers - For Music Production, Mixing, Mastering and Audiophile Use (Black & Gold)
feature_bullets: STUDIO STANDARD: Praised by top musicians, producers, and audio engineers, the CB-1 headphones are an industry standard in recording studios around the world. The CB-1s have received critical acclaim from the most discerning audiophiles on the web as well as top technology editors.

50MM Drivers: Large 50mm drivers deliver studio quality audio with a wide, expansive soundstage that puts you in the room with your favorite musicians. Hear music the way the artists, producers, mix and mastering engineers intended.

DESIGNED FOR COMFORT: The CB-1’s padded headband and overstuffed earpads were designed to be comfortable during multi-hour recording sessions. Its over-the-ear design fully encloses ear, offering passive noise cancelling without putting extra pressure on your head. The CB-1’s adjustable headband ensures a snug fit on your head, and clicking ridges allow for full customizability. .

TWO CABLES INCLUDED + ¼ ADAPTOR: The CB-1 comes with two 9-foot audio cables - one coiled, one straight. Both have a custom locking mechanism that keeps them attached to the headphones, eliminating the risk of dislodging the cable. The CB-1 is compatible with any 3.5mm audio cable, but it will lack this locking feature. We also provide a ¼ adaptor plug for use with professional audio equipment.

UNDERSTATED STYLE: The CB-1’s minimalist, unbranded aesthetic will never lose its luster or fall out of fashion. A slim frame doesn’t awkwardly protrude sideways, and the CB-1 can be folded to become compact for travel.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,732 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
